00017 Cartesian3DUnit::Cartesian3DUnit()
00018         : DataspaceUnit("cart3D")
00019 {;}
00020 
00021 
00022 Cartesian3DUnit::~Cartesian3DUnit()
00023 {;}
00024                 
00025 
00026 void Cartesian3DUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00027 {
00028         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00029         *(output+0) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0); //x 
00030         *(output+1) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1); //y
00031         *(output+2) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+2); //z
00032 }
00033 
00034 
00035 void Cartesian3DUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00036 {
00037         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00038         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, *(input+0));
00039         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, *(input+1));
00040         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, *(input+2));
00041 }

00051 
00052 void Cartesian2DUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00053 {
00054         *outputNumArgs = 2;
00055         *(output+0) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0); //x 
00056         *(output+1) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1); //y
00057 }
00058 
00059 void Cartesian2DUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00060 {
00061         *outputNumArgs = 2;
00062         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, *(input+0));
00063         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, *(input+1));
00064 }

00069 SphericalUnit::SphericalUnit()
00070         : DataspaceUnit("spherical")
00071 {;}
00072 
00073 
00074 SphericalUnit::~SphericalUnit()
00075 {;}
00076                 
00077                 
00078 void SphericalUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00079 {   //double kDegreesToRadians = kDegreesToRadians;
00080         double aa = (90. - atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0)) *  kDegreesToRadians; //a
00081         double ee = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1) *  kDegreesToRadians; //e
00082         double dd = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+2); //d
00083         
00084         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00085         double temp = cos(ee) * dd;             
00086         *(output+0) = cos(aa) * temp;
00087         *(output+1) =  sin(aa) * temp;
00088         *(output+2) =  sin(ee) * dd;
00089 }
00090 
00091 
00092 void SphericalUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00093 {   
00094     double xx = *(input+0);
00095         double yy = *(input+1);
00096         double zz = *(input+2);
00097         double temp = (xx * xx) + (yy * yy);
00098 
00099         *outputNumArgs = 3;     
00100         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, atan2(xx, yy) * kRadiansToDegrees); 
00101         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, atan2(zz, (pow((temp), 0.5))) * kRadiansToDegrees);
00102         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, pow((temp + (zz * zz)), 0.5));
00103 }
00104

00107 PolarUnit::PolarUnit()
00108         : DataspaceUnit("polar")
00109 {;}
00110 
00111 
00112 PolarUnit::~PolarUnit()
00113 {;}
00114                 
00115                 
00116 void PolarUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00117 {
00118     *outputNumArgs = 2;
00119         
00120         double aa = (90. - atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0)) * kDegreesToRadians; //a
00121         double dd = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1); //d
00122                                 
00123         *(output+0) = cos(aa)  * dd; //x
00124         *(output+1) = sin(aa) * dd; //y
00125         
00126                 
00127 }
00128 
00129 
00130 void PolarUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00131 {   
00132     double xx = *(input+0);
00133         double yy = *(input+1);
00134 
00135         *outputNumArgs = 2;
00136         
00137         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, atan2(xx, yy) * kRadiansToDegrees); //a
00138         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, pow(((xx * xx) + (yy * yy)), 0.5)); //distance    
00139 }

00143 OpenGlUnit::OpenGlUnit()
00144         : DataspaceUnit("openGl")
00145 {;}
00146 
00147 
00148 OpenGlUnit::~OpenGlUnit()
00149 {;}
00150                 
00151 
00152 void OpenGlUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00153 {
00154         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00155         *(output+0) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0); //x 
00156         *(output+1) = -1.0 * atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+2); //y
00157         *(output+2) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1); //z
00158 }
00159 
00160 
00161 void OpenGlUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00162 {
00163         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00164         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, *(input+0));//x
00165         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, *(input+2));//y
00166         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, *(input+1) * -1.0);//z
00167 }

00173 CylindricalUnit::CylindricalUnit()
00174         : DataspaceUnit("cylindrical")
00175 {;}
00176 
00177 
00178 CylindricalUnit::~CylindricalUnit()
00179 {;}
00180                 
00181 
00182 void CylindricalUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00183 {
00184         // Cylindrical coordinate System (according to ISO 31-11 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_31-11#Coordinate_systems )  = radius azimut hight
00185         
00186         *outputNumArgs = 3;
00187         double dd = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+0); //d
00188         double aa = (90. - atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+1)) * kDegreesToRadians; //a
00189         
00190                                 
00191         *(output+0) = cos(aa)  * dd; //x
00192         *(output+1) = sin(aa) * dd; //y
00193         *(output+2) = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms+2); //z
00194 }
00195 
00196 
00197 void CylindricalUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00198 {
00199          
00200          *outputNumArgs = 3;
00201          
00202          double xx = *(input+0);
00203      double yy = *(input+1);    
00204         
00205         // d a z
00206         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+0, pow(((xx * xx) + (yy * yy)), 0.5)); //distance
00207         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+1, atan2(xx, yy) * kRadiansToDegrees); //a
00208         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms+2, *(input+2));//z
00209 }
00210 
00211 
00212 /***********************************************************************************************/
00213 PositionDataspace::PositionDataspace()
00214         : DataspaceLib("position", "xyz")
00215 {
00216         // Create one of each kind of unit, and cache them in a hash
00217         registerUnit(new Cartesian3DUnit,       gensym("cart3D"));
00218         registerUnit(new Cartesian3DUnit,       gensym("xyz"));
00219         registerUnit(new Cartesian2DUnit,       gensym("cart2D"));
00220         registerUnit(new Cartesian2DUnit,       gensym("xy"));
00221         registerUnit(new SphericalUnit,         gensym("spherical"));
00222         registerUnit(new SphericalUnit,         gensym("aed"));
00223         registerUnit(new PolarUnit,                     gensym("polar"));
00224         registerUnit(new PolarUnit,                     gensym("ad"));
00225         registerUnit(new OpenGlUnit,            gensym("openGL"));
00226         registerUnit(new CylindricalUnit,       gensym("cylindrical"));
00227         registerUnit(new CylindricalUnit,       gensym("daz"));
00228         
00229         // Now that the cache is created, we can create a set of default units
00230         setInputUnit(neutralUnit);
00231         setOutputUnit(neutralUnit);
00232 }
00233 
00234 
00235 PositionDataspace::~PositionDataspace()
00236 {
00237         ;
00238 }
